expressivity.contactUtilizationMethod: Hold the straight shaft just below the curved handle with your dominant hand, slide the other hand to the midpoint, keep the ferrule end forward, and execute full overhead chopping swings.
expressivity.substrateUtilizationMethod: Keep the monitor standing on its pedestal at the front edge of the desk and direct each overhead chop so the ferrule makes contact with the flat aluminum stand just below the screen.
expressivity.expectedHapticFeedback: The user feels sharp initial impact as the axe strikes wood. Tension increases until a sudden satisfying release occurs - the wood cracks and splits completely.
expressivity.explanation: The umbrella ferrule is too light and small to convey a sharp, heavy impact or any splitting sensation on a rigid metal stand.

realism.physicalContactObject: white oscillating desk fan
realism.physicalSubstrateObject: silver iMac desktop monitor with black screen
realism.contactUtilizationMethod: Grip the cylindrical stem of the fan with one hand just above the base and swing the fan head a few centimeters forward and back like a mallet
realism.substrateUtilizationMethod: Keep the monitor standing as shown; bring the fan head straight toward the center of the glass and finish the swing by letting the grille glide a finger-width past the screen’s plane
realism.expectedHapticFeedback: The user should then experience a distinct "breakthrough" moment as the hammer penetrates the rind - a sudden release of resistance like breaking through a moderately tough shell
realism.explanation: Sliding the fan grille over glass produces only friction and no sense of ‘breakthrough’ resistance, so it fails to simulate rind penetration.

realism.physicalContactObject: white oscillating desk fan

realism.expectedHapticFeedback: The user should then experience a distinct "breakthrough" moment as the hammer penetrates the rind - a sudden release of resistance like breaking through a moderately tough shell
realism.explanation: The keys briefly move aside but there’s no sudden release of a tough barrier—just low-force key travel, so the ‘breakthrough’ moment is missing.

realism.expectedHapticFeedback: The user feels sharp initial impact as the axe strikes wood. Tension increases until a sudden satisfying release occurs - the wood cracks and splits completely.
realism.explanation: The sudden spring-open of the prongs gives a pop that parallels the release of a splitting action, though it’s very small scale.

realism.physicalContactObject: black-and-white patterned umbrella with curved handle
realism.contactUtilizationMethod: Hold the straight shaft just below the curved handle with your dominant hand, slide the other hand to the midpoint, keep the ferrule end forward, and execute full overhead chopping swings.
realism.substrateUtilizationMethod: Stand in front of one cushion and drive the ferrule down onto the centre of that cushion.
realism.expectedHapticFeedback: The user feels sharp initial impact as the axe strikes wood. Tension increases until a sudden satisfying release occurs - the wood cracks and splits completely.
realism.explanation: The sofa cushion is too soft and absorbing; there is no hard resistance or cracking sensation and the umbrella lacks the mass and rigidity of an axe.
